headline.main: Health of Justices Poses Little Threat to High Court

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The health of the aging liberal and centrist Justices on the Supreme Court is good enough to make another vacancy unlikely soon, according to close observers of the court.
docs.snippet: LEAD: The health of the aging liberal and centrist Justices on the Supreme Court is good enough to make another vacancy unlikely soon, according to close observers of the court.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: According to the Centers for Disease Control, among Americans age 17 and over only 26.5 percent now smoke. That's a drop of nearly five percentage points since 1986. Years of studies documenting health dangers and aggressive anti-smoking campaigns have had their effects.
